intro: Ione rimannii, commonly known as the Riemann's iris, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and wet meadows. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Due to habitat loss, Ione rimannii is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
